page.title: 13The Arts in Ilkeston
page.content: The area is served by a library, both lending and reference, one of the 2,800 Carnegie Free Libraries endowed by Andrew Carnegie, the Scottish born U.S. philanthropist. In addition there is a newly opened museum showing aspects of local life. There is also a cinema. To visit the theatre or larger museums or art galleries, one must visit either Derby or Nottingham. Within the area there are a number of very active amateur operatic and drama societies. There is also a local history society, a writers' workshop and civic society.
